conclusion: Identify the type of thermodynamic process from A to C.
Point A and point C are on different arms of the same line in the pV diagram.
Process A → B is an adiabatic process.
Process B → C is an isobaric process.
Process C → A is an isochoric process.
For isochoric process C → A, work done W = 0.
For isobaric process B → C, work done W = 1200 J.
Sum of work done in each segment equals zero.
For adiabatic process A → B, Q = 0.
Work done in adiabatic process A → B is related to change in internal energy.
Temperature at state C is the same as at state A due to conservation of energy.
The temperature of the gas at state C is 200 K.
